name: resiliently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that allows you to be happy, successful, etc. again after something difficult or bad has happened: The schoolchildren are taught to deal with difficulties resiliently. She coped very resiliently with the redundancy.
in a way that allows something to quickly return to its usual shape after being bent, stretched, or pressed: The arm is mounted resiliently between two hooks. This mechanism resiliently absorbs most of the torque.
More examplesFewer examplesDespite losing the first two sets, he hung on resiliently and fought back to win an epic match.She's such a resiliently positive character that it's always good to spend time with her.The value of the stock market has remained resiliently high.
